title: Integrated Learning Design for Foreign Language Vocabulary and Social Phenomena Using Educational Videos

context.prior_knowledge: Basic foreign language grammar and reading comprehension skills, understanding of fundamental social phenomena (history, geography, economics, politics, culture), and elementary recognition of civic rights and social systems
context.additional_context: A course integrating foreign language vocabulary and social phenomena through real-time video lectures in smartphone-centric, resource-limited environments. Project-based assessments (news article analysis, discussion topic development, policy proposal writing) measure the interconnection of language proficiency and social understanding, aiming to develop critical thinking and civic consciousness.

learning_goals: Learners accurately understand and utilize 200 essential foreign language vocabulary items within cultural contexts and social phenomena (e.g., civic engagement, economic disparity, multicultural policies) over 4 weeks.

Learners achieve over 80% vocabulary memorization accuracy via quizzes after watching educational videos and explain sociocultural implications (e.g., policy changes, inter-class relations, global trends).

Learners select 10 social phenomenon-related vocabulary items (e.g., civic engagement, economic disparity, multicultural policies) from video content, create 3+ real-situation scenarios (e.g., news analysis, debate topics, policy proposals) using the vocabulary, and achieve over 80% suitability in peer/teacher feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
